name: JSONStoreAddOptions
description: Options that are used to control the add operation in JSONStoreCollection.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

params.name: markDirty
params.description: Flag to mark a document dirty. Default is false.

params.name: additionalSearchFields
params.description: additional search fields for the add operation.

name: addAdditionalSearchField
description: Add an additional search field for the add operation.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of additional search field to include with the document.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of additional search field for 'key' to include with the document. Accepted value types are: ('string', 'boolean', 'integer', 'number')

name: addAdditionalSearchFields
description: Add multiple additional search fields for the add operation.

params.name: extraSearchFields
params.description: An JSON Object that contains key/value pairs for additional search fields.

name: JSONStoreChangeOptions
description: Options that are used to modify the change operation in JSONStoreCollection.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

params.name: addNew
params.description: Flag to set if the document should be added if a previously stored document could not be found.

params.name: markDirty
params.description: Flag to mark a document dirty. Default is false.

params.name: searchFieldCriteria
params.description: An Array of search fields that is used to compare in the database that is found in the document.

name: JSONStoreCollection
description: This class represents a single JSONStore collection. Operations on the collection can be done by using the API for this class.

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the JSONStoreCollection.

name: addData
description: Add data and create a new document in the collection.

params.name: data
params.description: New JSON data to be added to the collection

params.name: options
params.description: Options to be applied while adding the object

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: changeData
description: Change a list of documents in the collection.

params.name: dataList
params.description: List of JSON documents

params.name: jsonStoreChangeOptions
params.description: Options to be applied while changing the objects

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of number of documents affected and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: countAllDocuments
description: Count the number of documents in the collection.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of the count of all documents. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: countAllDirtyDocuments
description: Count the number of dirty documents in the collection.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of the count of all dirty documents. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: countDocuments
description: Count the number of documents in the collection that are based on the given query.

params.name: query
params.description: An array of JSONStoreQueryPart objects that limits the count scope. Every query part in the arrayare joined by an OR operation.

params.name: includeDeleted
params.description: Additional options to modify the count operation.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of the count of documents based on given query and whether to include deleted documents. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: clearCollection
description: Removes all documents from a collection, but does not destroy the collection.

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: findAllDirtyDocuments
description: Find all the dirty documents in the collection.

return.description: This function returns an array of documents that are found dirty in the collection. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: findAllDocuments
description: Find all documents in the collection.

params.name: options
params.description: The find query that restricts the search.

return.description: This function returns an array of documents that are found in the collection with the given Find Options. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: findDocumentById
description: Find a document in the collection based on the given ID.

params.name: id
params.description: The unique id that is associated with a document in the database (the _id search field).

return.description: This function returns a document that is found for this given id. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: findDocumentsById
description: Find all documents in the collection that have the given ids.

params.name: ids
params.description: An array of unique ids that are associated with a document in the database (the _id search field).

return.description: This function returns an array of all the documents that are found for this given ids. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: findDocuments
description: Find documents in the collection that are based on the given query.

params.name: query
params.description: An array of JSONStoreQueryPart objects that limits the count scope. Every query part in the arrayare joined by an OR operation.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional options to modify the count operation.

return.description: This function returns an array of all the documents that are found for this given query and find options. In case of any error this function returns a JSON.

name: getAdditionalSearchFields
description: Get a map of the additional search fields for this collection.

return.description: This function returns an object of all the additional search fields for the given collection.

name: getSearchFields
description: Get a map of all search fields for this collection.

return.description: This function returns an object of all the search fields for the given collection.

name: hasAdditionalSearchField
description: Determines if the collection contains the given additional search field.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The name of the additional search field to check for existence.

return.description: This function returns a boolean value indicative of whether the collection contains the given additional search field or not, and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: hasSearchField
description: The name of the search field to check for existence.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The name of the additional search field to check for existence.

return.description: This function returns a boolean value indicative of whether the collection contains the given search field or not, and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: isDocumentDirty
description: Determine if a document is dirty or not.

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the document to be checked.

return.description: This function returns a boolean value indicative of whether the document is dirty or not, and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: markDocumentClean
description: Mark a document in the collection clean.

params.name: document
params.description: JSON document to be marked as clean.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of number of documents affected and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: markDocumentsClean
description: Mark an array of documents in the collection clean.

params.name: documents
params.description: An Array of JSON documents to be marked as clean.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of number of documents affected and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: removeCollection
description: Permanently deletes all the documents that are stored in a collection and destroys the collection.

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: removeDocumentById
description: Remove a document from the collection that is based on the given id.

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the document to be deleted.

params.name: markDirty
params.description: Mark the document as dirty. Default is false.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of number of documents affected and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: removeDocumentsById
description: Remove array of documents from the collection, based on the given ids.

params.name: ids
params.description: ID of the document to be deleted.

params.name: markDirty
params.description: Mark the document as dirty using this flag. Default is false.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of number of documents affected and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: replaceDocument
description: Replace a document in the collection.

params.name: document
params.description: A JSONObject that represents the document to update in the collection. The document's '_id' is used to determine which document to replace.

params.name: markDirty
params.description: Mark the document as dirty using this flag. Default is false.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of number of documents affected and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: replaceDocuments
description: Replace an array of documents in the collection.

params.name: documents
params.description: A List that contains JSONObjects that represent the documents to update in the collection. The document's '_id' is used to determine which document to replace. If all documents could not be updated, a rollback is performed to a state where no documents were updated.

params.name: markDirty
params.description: Mark the document as dirty using this flag. Default is false.

return.description: This function returns a number indicative of number of documents affected and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: setAdditionalSearchField
description: Set an additional search field for the collection.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the additional search field to add. Only useful before the collection is opened.

params.name: searchFieldType
params.description: The type of the search field. Accepted values are ('boolean', 'integer', 'number', 'string')

name: setSearchField
description: Set a search field for the collection.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the additional search field to add. Only useful before the collection is opened.

params.name: searchFieldType
params.description: The type of the search field. Accepted values are ('boolean', 'integer', 'number', 'string')

name: sync
description: Sync this collection based on Sync policy set when the collection was opened.

name: wasReopened
description: Determine if the collection was reopened when it was initialized.

return.description: This function returns a boolean value and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: JSONStoreFindOptions
description: Options that are used to modify the find operation in JSONStoreCollection.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of results to be returned.

params.name: offset
params.description: The offset of which results will begin.

params.name: filters
params.description: The search fields to be returned on the results of the find operation.

params.name: sortAscending
params.description: The search fields by which the results will be sorted in ascending order.

params.name: sortDescending
params.description: The search fields by which the results will be sorted in descending order.

name: addFilter
description: Add a search filter to the existing list of search fields.

params.name: filterField
params.description: The search field to Filter

name: addSortAscending
description: Add a new search field by which the results will be sorted. The search field will sort the results in a ascending manner against the search field. Note that it will be sorted in the order that they were added. For example, if you add searchField1 and then searchField2, it will sort according to searchField1, and then any ties will be sorted according to searchField2.

params.name: sortField
params.description: The search field that is used for a ascending sort.

name: addSortDescending
description: Add a new search field by which the results will be sorted. The search field will sort the results in a descending manner against the search field. Please note that it will be sorted in the order that they were added. For example, if you add searchField1 and then searchField2, it will sort according to searchField1, and then any ties will be sorted according to searchField2.

params.name: sortField
params.description: The search field that is used for a descending sort.

name: JSONStoreInitOptions
description: Options that are used to modify the init operation in WLJSONStore.

name: constructor
description: Constructor to initialize JSONStoreInitOptions

params.name: username
params.description: The user name

params.name: password
params.description: The password to be used for the store.

params.name: enableAnalytics
params.description: When true, analytics will be logged for JSONStore.

params.name: secureRandom
params.description: The secure random string to be used by security artifacts.

name: setSyncOptions
description: Set Synchronization Options for the collection set

params.name: syncPolicy
params.description: Must be either of ['SYNC_NONE', 'SYNC_DOWNSTREAM', 'SYNC_UPSTREAM']

params.name: syncAdapterPath
params.description: Name of the Sync Adapter

name: JSONStoreQueryPart
description: This class is used to build query objects. It represents a group of operations that are joined with an AND.

name: addBetween
description: Add BETWEEN criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare start and end against with a BETWEEN statement.

params.name: start
params.description: All documents that are returned must have the search field set to a number greater than or equal to this start.

params.name: end
params.description: All documents that are returned must have the search field set to a number less than or equal to this end.

name: addNotBetween
description: Add NOT BETWEEN criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare start and end against with a NOT BETWEEN statement.

params.name: start
params.description: All documents that are returned must have the search field set to a number greater than or equal to this start.

params.name: end
params.description: All documents that are returned must have the search field set to a number less than or equal to this end.

name: addGreaterThan
description: Add GREATER THAN criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with a GREATER THAN statement.

params.name: value
params.description: All documents returned must have the search field set to a number greater than this value.

name: addGreaterThanOrEqual
description: Add GREATER THAN OR EQUAL criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with a GREATER THAN OR EQUAL statement.

params.name: value
params.description: All documents returned must have the search field set to a number greater than or equal to this value.

name: addLessThan
description: Add LESS THAN criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with a LESS THAN statement.

params.name: value
params.description: All documents returned must have the search field set to a number less than this value.

name: addLessThanOrEqual
description: Add LESS THAN OR EQUAL criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with a LESS THAN OR EQUAL statement.

params.name: value
params.description: All documents returned must have the search field set to a number less or equal than this value.

name: addInside
description: Add a INSIDE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with an INSIDE statement.

params.name: values
params.description: An non-empty list of numbers, booleans, and/or strings. All documents where the search field is one of the values in the list.

name: addNotInside
description: Add a NOT INSIDE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with a NOT INSIDE statement.

params.name: values
params.description: An non-empty list of numbers, booleans, and/or strings. All matching documents must not match the search field to one of the values in the list.

name: addEqual
description: Add a EQUAL criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with an EQUAL statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the EQUAL criteria.

name: addNotEqual
description: Add a NOT EQUAL criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with a NOT EQUAL statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the NOT EQUAL criteria.

name: addLike
description: Add a LIKE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare with a LIKE statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the LIKE criteria.

name: addLeftLike
description: Add a LEFT LIKE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare start and end against with a LEFT LIKE statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the LEFT LIKE criteria.

name: addRightLike
description: Add a RIGHT LIKE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare start and end against with a RIGHT LIKE statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the RIGHT LIKE criteria.

name: addNotLike
description: Add a NOT LIKE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare start and end against with a NOT LIKE statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the NOT LIKE criteria.

name: addNotLeftLike
description: Add a NOT LEFT LIKE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare start and end against with a NOT LEFT LIKE statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the NOT LEFT LIKE criteria.

name: addNotRightLike
description: Add a NOT RIGHT LIKE criteria to the query part.

params.name: searchField
params.description: The search field to compare start and end against with a NOT RIGHT LIKE statement.

params.name: value
params.description: Search field's value for the NOT RIGHT LIKE criteria.

name: JSONStoreSyncPolicy
description: This class contains Syncronization Policies for a JSONStore collection

return.description: Downstream Sync Policy
Upstream Sync Policy
This is the default Sync Policy

name: WLJSONStore
description: This class is the public WLJSONStore API for React-Native applications.

name: changePassword
description: Change the password for the given user.

params.name: username
params.description: The user name.

params.name: oldPassword
params.description: The old password.

params.name: newPassword
params.description: The new password.

params.name: pbkdf2Iterations
params.description: The number of iterations used by the Password-Based Key Derivation Function 2 algorithm used to secure the password.

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success and it returns a JSON in case of any error.

name: closeAll
description: Locks access to all the collections until the init method is called.

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: commitTransaction
description: Commit a transaction.

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: destroy
description: Permanently deletes all data for all users, clears security artifacts, and removes accessors.

params.name: username
params.description: The user name.

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: getFileInfo
description: Returns an array of objects with information about all the stores in the device.

return.description: This function returns an Array of JSON Objects in case of success, representing the details of the JSONStore info, and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: openCollections
description: Provides access to the collections that are inside the store, and creates them if they do not already exist.

params.name: collections
params.description: An array of collection definitions (JSONStoreCollection objects) that are to be initialized (either reopened or created).

params.name: options
params.description: An object of class JSONStoreInitOptions. This is a specific set of options to initialize the collection with (such as security credentials).

return.description: This function returns an empty string in case of success and it returns a JSON in case of any error

name: rollbackTransaction
description: Roll back a transaction.

return.description: This returns a boolean value on completion - true for success, false for failure.

name: setAnalyticsEnabled
description: Enable or disable the collection of analytic data for JSONStore.

params.name: isAnalyticsEnabled
params.description: ture: to collect Analytics data, false: otherwise

name: startTransaction
description: Start a transaction.

return.description: This returns an empty string on success, and a JSON in case of any error.

name: WLLogger
description:
WLLogger is a class for logging that provides some enhanced capability such as capturing log calls, 
package filtering, and log level control at both global and individual package scope. 

It also provides a method call to send captured logs to the IBM MobileFirst Platform server. 

Log file data is sent to the IBM MobileFirst Platform server when this class's send() method is called and the accumulated log size is greater than zero. 
When the log data is successfully uploaded, the persisted local log data is deleted.

When this Logger class's capture flag is turned on via setCapture(true) method call, 
all messages passed through this class's log methods will be persisted to store in the following JSON object format:
examples:
{
  "timestamp"    : "17-02-2013 13:54:27:123",  // "dd-MM-yyyy hh:mm:ss:S"
  "level"        : "ERROR",                    // FATAL || ERROR || WARN || INFO || LOG || DEBUG || TRACE
  "package"      : "your_tag",                 // typically a class name, app name, or JavaScript object name
  "msg"          : "the message",              // a helpful log message
  "metadata"     : {"hi": "world"},            // (optional) additional JSON metadata, appended via doLog API call
  "threadid"     : long                        // (optional) id of the current thread
}

unknown.tagValue: Create or get an instance of the WLLogger class for a given tag.

name: debug
description: Logs a message at DEBUG level

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log.

name: debugWithMetadata
description: Logs a message at DEBUG level with additional metadata. The metadata is available as custom fields while creating custom charts on the MobileFirst Analytics Console.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log

params.name: metadata
params.description: Any additional metadata to log.

name: error
description: Logs a message at ERROR level

params.name: message
params.description: The error  message to log.

name: errorWithMetadata
description: Logs a message at ERROR level with additional metadata. The metadata is available as custom fields while creating custom charts on the MobileFirst Analytics Console.

params.name: message
params.description: The error message to log

params.name: metadata
params.description: Any additional metadata to log.

name: warn
description: Logs a message at WARN level

params.name: message
params.description: The warning message to log.

name: warnWithMetadata
description: Logs a message at WARN level with additional metadata. The metadata is available as custom fields while creating custom charts on the MobileFirst Analytics Console.

params.name: message
params.description: The warning message to log

params.name: metadata
params.description: Any additional metadata to log.

name: info
description: Logs a message at INFO level

params.name: message
params.description: The information message to log.

name: infoWithMetadata
description: Logs a message at INFO level with additional metadata. The metadata is available as custom fields while creating custom charts on the MobileFirst Analytics Console.

params.name: message
params.description: The information message to log

params.name: metadata
params.description: Any additional metadata to log.

name: trace
description: Logs a message at TRACE level

params.name: message
params.description: The trace message to log.

name: traceWithMetadata
description: Logs a message at TRACE level with additional metadata. The metadata is available as custom fields while creating custom charts on the MobileFirst Analytics Console.

params.name: message
params.description: The trace message to log

params.name: metadata
params.description: Any additional metadata to log.

name: setCapture
description: Global setting to turn persisting of log data passed to this class's log methods on or off.

params.name: capture
params.description: True to turn on logging, false to turn it off.

name: getCapture
description: Get the current value of the capture flag, indicating that the Logger is recording log calls persistently.

return.description: true, if logging is enabled, false otherwise.

name: setFilters
description:
Filter on packages at and above designated LEVEL. 
This is a white list. Any package not listed in the filters will not be logged. 
Pass null or an empty HashMap parameter to remove filters and resume logging at the default LEVEL.

params.name: filter
params.description: set of filters and associated level (and above) to allow for logging

name: getFilters
description: Get the current list of filters.

return.description: The current list of filters in the form of  {"packageName" : "LEVEL"}

name: getLevel
description: Get the current Logger level.

return.description: A string representation of the current Logging level. Possible values are TRACE, DEBUG, LOG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL. The default value is FATAL.

name: send
description:
Send the accumulated log data when the persistent log buffer exists and is not empty. 
The data accumulates in the log buffer from the use of Logger with capture turned on.

name: setLevel
description:
Set the level and above at which log messages should be saved/printed. 
A null parameter value is ignored and has no effect.

params.name: level
params.description: A string representation of the Logger level. Valid values are TRACE, DEBUG, LOG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL. You can use the properties defined in WLLogger as well.

name: updateConfigFromServer
description:
Get and apply the configuration from the IBM MobileFirst Platform Server. 
The configuration comes from the use of the "Config Profiles" tab in the IBM MobileFirst Platform administrative console.

name: getMaxFileSize
description: Get the current setting for the max file size threshold.

return.description: The current threashold of the maximum file size.

name: setMaxFileSize
description:
Set the maximum size of the local log file. Once the maximum file size is reached, no more data will be appended. 
The file must then be sent to the server using the send() API.

params.name: sizeInBytes
params.description: The maximum size of the file in number of bytes. The minimum is 10000.

content:
# 
<!---
   Licensed Materials - Property of IBM

   (C) Copyright 2019 IBM Corp.

   Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
   distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
   WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
   See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
   limitations under the License.
-->

# React Native SDK for IBM MobileFirst JSONStore

## Description
The IBM Mobile Foundation JSONStore is an optional client-side API providing a lightweight, document-oriented storage system. JSONStore enables persistent storage of JSON documents. Documents in an application are available in JSONStore even when the device is offline. This persistent, always-available storage can be useful to give users access to documents when,for example, there is no network connection available in the device.

### Key features
* Automatic upstream or downstream synchronization of on-device data with a Cloudant database (or a database compliant with the Couch DB protocol).
* Data indexing for efficient searching
* Mechanism for tracking local-only changes to the stored data
* Support for multiple users
* AES 256 encryption of stored data provides security and confidentiality. You can segment protection by user with password-protection, in the case of more than one user on a single device.

Read more about JSONStore [here](http://mobilefirstplatform.ibmcloud.com/tutorials/en/foundation/8.0/application-development/jsonstore/).

## Changelog
For details of the changes in this latest release, visit the [IBM Mobile Foundation Blog](http://mobilefirstplatform.ibmcloud.com/blog/2018/05/18/8-0-master-ifix-release).


## Installation

The IBM MobileFirst™ JSONStore SDK for React Native apps is dependent on the [IBM MobileFirst Foundation SDK](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-ibm-mobilefirst). If you have already added the IBM MobileFirst Foundation SDK to your app, continue with the instructions below.

Navigate to the folder of your React Native app and run the following command to install the JSONStore SDK for React Native apps. 

`npm install react-native-ibm-mobilefirst-jsonstore --save`
	
## Getting Started 

### Pre-requisites 
1. Make sure you have all the pre-requisites for a React Native app covered. See the [React Native Getting Started](https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/getting-started.html) page if you're new to this whole stuff. 

2. A [Mobile Foundation instance on IBM Cloud] (https://console.bluemix.net/catalog/services/Mobile%20Foundation) OR
an [on-premise installation](https://mobilefirstplatform.ibmcloud.com/tutorials/en/foundation/8.0/installation-configuration/) of the IBM Mobile Foundation server. 


### Create a React Native Project 

* The first step is to create a React Native project. Let's call our app as the `JSONStoreApp`. Use the React Native CLI to create a new project. 

> `react-native init JSONStoreApp`
> 
>`cd JSONStoreApp `

* Install the MobileFirst Core SDK and complete the Getting Started Instructions from [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-ibm-mobilefirst). 

* Next, add the IBM MobileFirst JSONStore SDK to your app


>`npm install react-native-ibm-mobilefirst-jsonstore —-save`

* Link your project so that all native dependencies are added to your React Native project. 

>`react-native link`




### Creating a JSONStore Collection

The first step in using the JSONStore API is to create a JSONStore Collection. 

Import the JSONStore classes into your application. Open `App.js` and add the following line among the other import statements

```
import {WLJSONStore, JSONStoreCollection} from 'react-native-ibm-mobilefirst-jsonstore'; 
```

Next, create and open a collection. You can open multiple collections at once. Pass a `JSONStoreInitOptions` parameter for advanced options such as protecting your collection with a password, setting up sync policies etc. 

```
var dogs = new JSONStoreCollection('dogs'); 
WLJSONStore.openCollections(['dogs']);  // Provide the name of the collection as a string. 
```

### Adding data to a collection 
Add JSON data to your collection. 

```
	var hachi = { "name" : "Hachiko" , "breed" : "Akita" , "country" : "Japan"}; 
    dogs.addData(hachi).then( ()=> { 
      // Data was added to the collection successfully.
    }).catch ( (err) => { 
      // Error adding data. See the err object for more information on the error 
    })
```

### Querying data from a collection 
Use any of the JSONStoreCollection.find* APIs to query a collection. 
Use JSONStoreQueryPart and JSONStoreQuery APIs for advanced filtering and querying of JSON data. 

```
	dogs.findAllDocuments().then( (result) => { 
       // result will have all the documents in the collection 
       // E.g. [ {"json": {"name":"Hachiko","breed":"Akita","country":"Japan"},"_id":2}]       
     }).catch((error) => {
        console.error ("Error finding docs " +  JSON.stringify(error));
     });
```

### Closing, clearing and destroying your collection 
Closing your collection will close your JSONStore collection for further access until it is opened again using the `openCollections` API 

```
WLJSONStore.closeAll()
```

Clearing a collection will remove all documents from a collection but does not destroy it. 

```
	dogs.clearCollection().then (()=>{
		// All documents cleared successfully
     }).catch( (err) => { 
       // An error occurred while clearing the collection. 
     })
```

Destroying a collection will permanently delete all data, all accessors and security artifacts. A collection once destroyed cannot be restored. All collections of the app will be destroyed. 

```
	WLJSONStore.destroy()
```



## Supported platforms
- Android
- iOS
